brief_summary.textblock:
This is an open-label, 2-period, absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion (ADME)
      and absolute bioavailability study in 6 healthy adult male subjects.

clinical_study.brief_title: IPI-145 ADME and Absolute Bioavailability Study

detailed_description.textblock:
In Period 1, subjects will receive a single oral dose of 25 mg IPI-145, followed by a
      15-minute IV infusion of approximately 2.8 μg 14C-IPI-145 containing 14.8 kBq of
      radioactivity.

      In Period 2, the same subjects will receive a single dose of 25 mg 14C-IPI-145 as an oral
      suspension, containing approximately 3.15 MBq of radioactivity.

      There will be a washout period of at least 14 days between Period 1 and Period 2.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Males, between 18 and 45 years of age, inclusive Body Mass Index (BMI) : 18.0-30.0
             kg/m2

          -  In good health, determined by no clinically significant findings from medical
             history, physical examination (Check-in), 12-lead ECG, and vital signs

          -  Provision of signed and dated, written informed consent prior to any study specific
             procedures

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Evidence of clinically significant medical conditions

          -  History of gastrointestinal surgery that may affect drug absorption

          -  Positive or indeterminate QuantiFERON-TB Gold test at screening

          -  Any active infection at the time of screening or admission

          -  Participation in another ADME study with a radiation burden >0.1 mSv in the period of
             1 year before screening

          -  Irregular defecation pattern (less than once per 2 days)

intervention.description: Intravenous infusion: approximately 2.8 μg IPI-145 containing 14.8 kBq of radioactivity; Oral suspension: 25 mg IPI-145 containing approximately 3.15 MBq of radioactivity; Oral capsule: 25 mg IPI-145

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Open-Label Study of the Absorption, Distribution, Metabolism and Excretion of 14C-Labeled IPI-145 and the Absolute Bioavailability of IPI-145 in Healthy Subjects

oversight_info.authority: Netherlands: The Central Committee on Research Involving Human Subjects (CCMO)

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters (AUC) of IPI-145 in plasma
PK parameters (AUC) and radioactivity excreted in urine and feces
PK parameters (Cmax) of IPI-145 in plasma
PK parameters (t1/2) of IPI-145 in plasma
PK parameters (Cmax) and radioactivity excreted in urine and feces
PK parameters (t1/2) and radioactivity excreted in urine and feces

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events following a single dose administration of IPI-145

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
